sen.j: 川本 幸民（かわもと こうみん、文化 (元号)7年（1810年） - 明治4年6月1日 (旧暦)（1871年7月18日））は、幕末・明治維新期の蘭学者。
sen.e: Komin KAWAMOTO (1810 to July 18, 1871) was a scholar of Western sciences who studied by the means of the Dutch language at the end of the Edo period and in the period of the Meiji Restoration.
Komin KAWAMOTO (1810 to July 18, 1871) was a scholar of Western sciences by the means of the Dutch language at the end of the Edo period and in the period of the Meiji Restoration.
sen.cmt: who studied は不要と思われます。
sen.e: Komin KAWAMOTO (1810 to July 18, 1871) was a scholar of Western sciences by the means of the Dutch language at the end of the Edo period and in the period of the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 名は裕（ゆたか）、号は裕軒（ゆうけん）。
sen.e: His given name was Yutaka, and he also had a title, Yuken.

sen.cmt: このほうが自然だと思います。

sen.j: 三田藩侍医の川本周安の息子。
sen.e: A son of Shuan (周安) KAWAMOTO, a court physician in Sanda Domain.
The court physician of Sanda Domain, Shuan KAWAMOTO's son.
sen.cmt: a son と訳出されているが、一人息子で「ない」印象がを与えるとおもわれる。周安=しゅうあん ↓以下のサイトより確認。http://www.city.sanda.lg.jp/kouhou/kouhoushi/documents/2020_04_15-5.pdf
sen.e: The court physician of Sanda Domain, Shuan KAWAMOTO's son.

sen.j: 当時の三田藩藩主九鬼隆国に命ぜられ1829年（文政12年）江戸に留学し、足立長雋、坪井信道らに蘭学を学び、物理・化学に精通。
sen.e: Ordered by Takakuni KUKI, the lord of the Sanda Domain, to go to Edo for study in 1829, he learned Western sciences from Choshun ADACHI and Shindo TSUBOI, and specialized in physics and chemistry.
Ordered by Takakuni KUKI, the lord of the Sanda Domain, he went to Edo to study in 1829, he learned Western sciences from Choshun ADACHI and Shindo TSUBOI, and specialized in physics and chemistry.
sen.cmt: to go to Edo for study in 1829 では、やや不自然だと思われます。
sen.e: Ordered by Takakuni KUKI, the lord of the Sanda Domain, he went to Edo to study in 1829, he learned Western sciences from Choshun ADACHI and Shindo TSUBOI, and specialized in physics and chemistry.

sen.j: 1833年（天保4年）三田市に帰郷し、父と同じ藩医に任じられた。
sen.e: In 1833, he returned to Sanda City, where he was appointed to a doctor working for the domain like his father.
In 1833, he returned to Sanda City, where he was appointed to a doctor working for the domain like his father.
In 1833, he returned to Sanda City, where he was appointed to a doctor working for the domain like his father.

sen.j: 薩摩藩藩主島津斉彬に見い出され、薩摩藩籍となる。
sen.e: Esteemed highly by Nariakira SHIMAZU, the lord of Satsuma Domain, he transferred to Satsuma Domain.
Highly esteemed by Nariakira SHIMAZU, the lord of Satsuma Domain, he was transferred to Satsuma Domain.
sen.cmt: highly は動詞＋by の前においたほうが流れがよいと思います。Transferredは受身です。
sen.e: Highly esteemed by Nariakira SHIMAZU, the lord of Satsuma Domain, he was transferred to Satsuma Domain.

sen.j: 1859年に薩摩藩校学頭、蕃書調所教授となる。
sen.e: In 1859, he became the principal of a domain school in Satsuma, and a professor of the research institution for Western education operated by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 検索すると「学頭」は校長の意味になっています。内容からも、head studentは誤りだと思われます。「蕃書調所は、江戸幕府直轄の洋学教育研究機関」とありますので、この意味で訳してあります。
sen.e: In 1859, he became the headmaster of a clan school in the Satsuma Domain and a professor of the research institution for Western education operated by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 藩校=clan school http://patrickmccoy.typepad.com/jic/2008/01/index.html principal も「校長」を表すのだが、headmasterのほうが「頭＝head」が語の中に含まれており、より原語に近いと思われます。
sen.e: In 1859, he became the headmaster of a clan school in the Satsuma Domain and a professor of the research institution for Western education operated by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 多くの科学の著訳書があり、日本の科学の発展に貢献した。
sen.e: Translating and writing plenty of science books, he contributed to development of Japanese science.
He has written and translated many literature on science, and made a great contribution to the development of science in Japan.
sen.cmt: スタイルを変更しました。
sen.e: He has written and translated many literature on science, and made a great contribution to the development of science in Japan.

sen.j: 白砂糖、マッチ、銀板写真なども試作していた。
sen.e: He experimentally produced white sugar, matches and daguerreotypes.
He experimentally produced white sugar, matches and daguerreotypes.

sen.j: また、1853年（嘉永6年）頃、日本で初めてビールを試醸し、浅草の曹源寺で試飲会を開催。
sen.e: In addition, he brewed beer for trial first in Japan in 1853, and organized a tasting event at Sogen-ji Temple in Asakusa, Edo.
Also, in 1853 he tried brewing beer for the first time in Japan, and organized a tasting event at Sogen-ji Temple in Asakusa, Edo.

sen.j: キリンビールのビール5000年の旅探究プロジェクトの一環としてそのことが取り上げられ、広告などに使われた。

This episode was mentioned in the Kirin Brewery Company's project which explores the history of 5000 years of beer, and it was used for its advertisements.

sen.e: In 1868, he went back to Sanda City, where he founded a private school named Eiran juku.

sen.j: 分校が出来るほど盛況となったが、その後息子の清二郎が太政官出仕となり共に再び上京。
sen.e: Although this private school was so popular that a branch school was established, he went to Tokyo again with his son Seijiro, who would serve the national government as a grand council of state.

This private school became as successful as branch(es) had to be built, however, when his son, Seijiro was employed as a grand council of state to serve the national government, he accompanied his son and moved back to Tokyo.
